note.p: Burial: Choir of York Minster, York, Yorkshire
Education: Westminster School; St John's College, Cambridge

Career: Lord Lieutenant of East and North Ridings, Yorkshire; Lord of the Bedchamber to George II and George III (1751-1762); First Lord of the Treasury (ie Prime Minister) (1765-1766, 1782); died of influenza
Honours: Baron and Earl of Malton (Ireland) 1750; KG 1760
References: W H G Armytage, 'Charles Watson-Wentworth, Second Marquess of Rockingham, FRS (1730-1782): Some Aspects of his Scientific Interests' in NR 1956-57 vol 12 pp 64-76, plate
